intro: Lepidium latipes, commonly known as the clustered peppergrass, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops such as cabbage and mustard. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and pungent aroma. Its leaves are alternate, linear, and often have a slight pubescence. Lepidium latipes is also known for its ability to thrive in arid environments, making it an important species in ecological restoration projects.
